title: Why Do We Vote On Tuesday?
teaser: Nick Andersen explores why America votes on the first Tuesday after the first Monday -- and what that means for voter turnout.
contentencoded:
Why do we vote on this random Tuesday in early November — not the first Tuesday, but the first Tuesday after the first Monday — and what does that mean for voter turnout? Nick Andersen, a producer for WBUR’s On Point with Tom Ashbrook, takes a closer look.

  • Hear the full episode of The Explicast, “Why Is Election Day On A Tuesday?”
  • See more from The Explicast

Reporter

  • Nick Andersen, associate producer at NPR and WBUR’s On Point with Tom Ashbrook and host of “The Explicast” podcast. He tweets @nicktheandersen and @TheExplicast.
